definitions: skilled worker who designs and builds fine wooden furniture and cabinets
examples: The cabinetmaker crafted beautiful custom kitchen cabinets
My grandfather worked as a cabinetmaker for forty years

definitions: railway car at the end of a freight train for crew
examples: The conductor rode in the red caboose at the end
Children love watching the caboose pass by on trains

definitions: car with a folding roof that can be lowered or removed
examples: She drove her new cabriolet with the top down
The vintage cabriolet turned heads at the car show

definitions: tropical tree that produces pods containing seeds used to make chocolate
seed from the cacao tree used to produce chocolate and cocoa
examples: Farmers harvest cacao pods from trees twice a year
The cacao plantation stretched for miles in the valley
Premium chocolate requires high quality cacao beans
They roasted the cacao beans before grinding them

definitions: secret hiding place for storing supplies or valuables
collection of items stored in a hidden or secure location
examples: The hikers found an emergency cache of food supplies
Pirates buried their treasure in a secret cache
The computer stores frequently used data in its cache
Archaeologists discovered a cache of ancient artifacts

definitions: quality of being respected, admired, or having high status
official seal or mark showing authenticity or approval
examples: The university's name carries considerable cachet with employers
Designer labels add cachet to ordinary clothing items
The document bore the official cachet of the embassy
Letters required the king's cachet to be valid

definitions: unpleasant mixture of loud, discordant sounds creating auditory chaos
examples: The construction site produced a cacophony of drilling noises
A cacophony of car horns filled the busy intersection

definitions: man who behaves dishonorably, especially toward women
examples: He proved himself a cad by breaking his promises
The Victorian novel featured a cad who deceived women

definitions: dead human body, especially one used for medical study
examples: Medical students studied anatomy using preserved cadavers
The forensic team examined the cadaver for evidence

definitions: person who carries golf clubs and assists players during games
examples: The professional golfer's caddie offered advice on club selection
She worked as a caddie at the country club

definitions: small container or box for storing and organizing items
examples: She kept her tea bags in a decorative caddy
The desk caddy held pens, pencils, and paper clips

definitions: rhythmic flow or pattern of sounds, especially in speech or music
rise and fall of voice pitch at the end of phrases
examples: The marching band maintained a steady cadence
Poetry often relies on cadence for its musical quality
Her speech had a pleasant cadence that held attention
The sergeant called out cadence during the march

definitions: elaborate solo passage in a concerto allowing performer to display virtuosity
examples: The violinist performed a brilliant cadenza in the concerto
The pianist improvised an original cadenza during the performance

definitions: student training to become an officer in armed forces or police
examples: The cadet completed basic training at the military academy
Police cadets undergo rigorous physical and academic preparation

definitions: soft, bluish-white metallic element used in batteries, pigments, and metal plating
examples: Cadmium is toxic and requires careful handling in manufacturing
The artist used cadmium yellow pigment for bright colors

definitions: small group of trained people forming the nucleus of a larger organization
examples: The revolutionary cadre planned strategies for the movement
A cadre of experienced teachers mentored new faculty members

definitions: surgical operation to deliver a baby by cutting through the mother's abdomen
examples: The doctor performed an emergency caesarean to save the baby
She recovered quickly after her scheduled caesarean delivery

definitions: soft, silvery-gold alkali metal element used in atomic clocks and medical applications
examples: Caesium atomic clocks provide extremely accurate time measurements
The element caesium reacts violently when exposed to water

definitions: restaurant where customers select food from displays and carry it on trays
examples: Students ate lunch in the school cafeteria every day
The hospital cafeteria offers healthy meal options for visitors

definitions: natural stimulant found in coffee, tea, and other plants that increases alertness
examples: Many people rely on caffeine to start their mornings
The energy drink contained high levels of caffeine

definitions: reptile similar to an alligator native to Central and South America
examples: The caiman basked on the riverbank in the Amazon
Caimans hunt fish and small mammals in tropical waters

definitions: mound of stones built as a memorial or landmark
examples: Hikers followed cairns marking the mountain trail
Ancient peoples built cairns to mark burial sites

definitions: watertight chamber used in underwater construction work
wheeled vehicle for transporting ammunition in military operations
examples: Workers used a caisson to build the bridge foundation underwater
The construction crew pumped water out of the caisson
Artillery units moved caissons filled with shells to the front
The old caisson was displayed at the military museum

definitions: gourd from a vine whose dried shell is used as a container
examples: Musicians made instruments from dried calabash shells
The farmer grew calabash gourds for making water vessels

definitions: event causing great damage, distress, or suffering to many people
examples: The earthquake was a calamity that destroyed entire cities
Financial calamity struck when the stock market crashed

definitions: process by which organic tissue becomes hardened by calcium salt deposits
examples: X-rays revealed calcification in the patient's arteries
Calcification of cartilage occurs naturally with aging

definitions: common mineral form of calcium carbonate found in limestone and marble
examples: Geologists identified calcite crystals in the cave formations
The limestone contained high concentrations of calcite

definitions: metallic element essential for bones, teeth, and various bodily functions
examples: Dairy products provide calcium for strong bones and teeth
The doctor prescribed calcium supplements for bone health

definitions: electronic device for performing mathematical calculations
examples: Students used calculators during the mathematics exam
The accountant checked figures with her desktop calculator

definitions: large volcanic crater formed by the collapse of a volcano's summit
examples: The caldera filled with water to form a crater lake
Scientists studied the ancient caldera for volcanic activity

definitions: young cow or bull, especially one under a year old
fleshy back part of the leg below the knee
examples: The calf stayed close to its mother in the pasture
Farmers bottle-fed the orphaned calf twice daily
She stretched her calf muscles before running the marathon
The athlete suffered a painful calf strain during practice

definitions: internal diameter of a gun barrel or bullet size
degree of quality, ability, or excellence of someone or something
examples: The rifle fired bullets of .22 caliber
Police recovered shell casings to determine the weapon's caliber
We need employees of the highest caliber for this project
The university attracts students of exceptional caliber

definitions: process of adjusting or marking instrument settings for accurate measurements
examples: The technician performed calibration on all laboratory equipment
Regular calibration ensures the scale gives accurate readings

definitions: internal diameter of a gun barrel or bullet size
degree of quality, ability, or excellence of someone or something
examples: The antique pistol had a large calibre barrel
Detectives identified the weapon by its calibre
Athletes of Olympic calibre train for years
The company seeks candidates of professional calibre

definitions: plain cotton fabric with printed patterns, originally from India
cat with patches of different colors, typically white, orange, and black
examples: She made curtains from bright calico fabric
The pioneer women wore dresses made of calico
The calico cat had distinctive orange and black patches
Our calico kitten loved to sleep in sunny spots

definitions: instrument with two hinged legs for measuring thickness or diameter
metal support attached to the leg to assist walking
examples: The machinist used calipers to measure the part precisely
Digital calipers provide measurements to thousandths of inches
The child wore leg calipers to help him walk
Orthopedic calipers supported her weakened ankle

definitions: supreme Muslim civil and religious ruler regarded as Muhammad's successor
examples: The caliph ruled over the vast Islamic empire
Historical caliphs combined political and spiritual authority

definitions: Islamic state led by a caliph as political and religious successor to Muhammad
examples: The medieval caliphate extended across three continents
Scholars studied the administration of the early caliphate

definitions: return telephone call or response to an earlier contact
invitation to return for a second audition or interview
examples: The customer service representative promised a callback within hours
I'm waiting for a callback about the job application
The actor received a callback for the lead role
Only ten performers got callbacks after the initial audition

definitions: person skilled in decorative handwriting as an art form
examples: The calligrapher created beautiful wedding invitations by hand
Medieval calligraphers spent years perfecting their craft

definitions: art of producing beautiful handwriting with special pens or brushes
examples: She studied Chinese calligraphy for five years
The diploma featured elegant calligraphy of the graduate's name

definitions: strong inner impulse toward a particular course of action or career
profession or occupation, especially one requiring dedication
examples: Teaching was more than a job, it was her calling
He felt a calling to help disadvantaged communities
Medicine has been the family calling for three generations
She found her calling as a social worker

definitions: musical instrument producing sound by forcing steam through whistles
examples: The circus calliope played cheerful tunes before the show
You could hear the riverboat's calliope from miles away

definitions: action or quality that makes someone feel more peaceful and relaxed
examples: The calming of the storm brought relief to sailors
Meditation provides a calming influence during stressful times

definitions: ceremonial pipe used by Native Americans for sacred rituals and treaties
examples: The tribal leaders smoked the calumet to seal their agreement
Museums display ornate calumets used in peace ceremonies
